column4: sorry, is there a guide to configure and install alsa in ububtu? please
ubuntu uses alsa by default
it doesn't work on my pc
what doesn't work?
i don't know. i can't hear nothing and when i try to configure the volume there is is error like this "no alsa device configured"
what kind of sound card do you have?
is the sound card integrated in the mobo
what chipset?
QDI Kinetiz 7EA
is it supported in linux?
i don't know
go search google real quick, search for your card w/ 'linux' after it and see what you can dig up
it's possible there is no driver, or that you need to get one from an external source
ok thanks
actually, can you type 'lspci' and then look for what kind of 'audio controller' it lists?
ok 2 seconds please
what do you nned?
i connect from the ubuntu computer with an other nick so i can paste the results?
yeah, you need to run this on the ubuntu computer: 'lspci'
it will list all the pci devices on your computer, just look for the one that says 'Multimedia audio controller' (or something along those lines), and  tell me what it is
go ahead and paste it in #flood
